DOC.brief_summary: The main aim of this study is to determine whether there is a difference in time to diagnosis of advanced colorectal neoplasms using quantitative Fecal Immunochemical Tests (FIT) to prioritize referral for colonoscopy (intervention) compared to usual care (qualitative FIT and appointment-based referral).
DOC.brief_title: Quantitative Versus Qualitative Fecal Immunochemical Tests (FIT) to Prioritize Urgency of Colonoscopy Referral
DOC.detailed_description: It is hypothesized that quantitative FIT will enable faster detection of advanced neoplasms compared to qualitative FIT.
DOC.criteria: Adults aged 50 years and above Lower gastrointestinal tract symptoms such as diarrhoea, constipation, per rectal bleeding Personal history of colorectal tumour or cancer Family history of familial adenomatous polyposis or hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer
